header_summary: Salvatore expresses gratitude to Antoine for his comments and insights, mentioning goals and potential restrictions. He discusses cross-input introspection and explains its relevance to CCV+CHECKSIGFROMSTACK. Salvatore addresses concerns on covenant opcodes and suggests limitations, inviting further discussion. The email covers topics like generic introspection, deferred checks, and updates to the BIP. The discussion also includes the concept of probability in the context of anonymity and the need for further exploration. Lastly, it suggests revisiting post-PTLCs and implementing classic keysend as MPP. Tony and Bastien discuss deanonymizing techniques used on the Lightning Network, highlighting the limitations.

recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Salvatore expresses gratitude to Antoine for comments and insights regarding facilitating experimentation.
- Salvatore discusses potential use cases of cross-input introspection and suggests adding restrictions if necessary.
- Salvatore addresses concerns about covenant opcodes and suggests limiting them but exploring their potential.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP incorporates a DH cryptosystem, with the receiver sharing only a public key in BIP 21.
- This change was made in response to Adam's comments to enhance the BIP.
- The goal is to enable a convenient experience while minimizing the risk of fund loss.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin (AdamISZ)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email suggests that the URI version of base64 is preferred.
- QR codes treat binary data, so both options will double the QR density.
- UR encoding is recommended for efficient QR codes and animated data carrying capacity.

recent_posts.title: Backing up channel state with counterparties
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion focuses on probability in the context of anonymity.
- An attack starts before there is an open channel with the victim.
- The event of Alice restoring from seed is planned by the attacker, not random.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- The email proposes revisiting post-PTLCs scenario and adopting classic keysend as MPP.
- CLN and LDK already support this feature, and it should be implemented by others.
- Recipients can claim less than the amount sent, but the sender still considers it as payment.

recent_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
recent_posts.summary:
- Tony explains that deanonymizing techniques on the Lightning Network only expose the recipient.
- Bastien argues that while mobile wallets reveal sender/recipient, blinded paths protect payment destinations.
- Tony raises concerns about privacy and decentralization, suggesting blinded paths may favor regulated nodes.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- A version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains is being implemented.
- The server (party 1) will be 'blinded' and won't learn certain information.
- Security in blinded statechains relies on trusting the server's reporting and client-side verification.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark is a new protocol similar to Lightning network for sending and receiving funds.
- It uses virtual UTXOs (vTXOs) off-chain that must be spent within four weeks.
- An intermediary called Ark Service Provider (ASP) enables anonymous, off-chain payments.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets should implement expiration dates for Silent Payment addresses to prevent loss of funds.
- Adding a 3-byte field to addresses encoding expiration date can solve the problem.
- Lightning invoices should also have expiration dates for a better user experience.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new way to make lightning channels resumable from a wallet seed.
- It addresses channel backup issues and proposes fraud proofs to detect revoked states.
- The proposal also discusses saving bandwidth and concludes with remarks on device usage.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We will conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and reputation tracking using real-world data.
- The plan involves collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate and ask questions.
